main event: Multiple sightings of a circular, bright object with reflective qualities were observed near Ellesmere Island in 1955.
interesting points: The object remained stationary for approximately 10 minutes before suddenly moving at a very high rate of speed.
It disappeared from sight in 15-20 seconds after changing direction towards the northwest.
The object was observed by 4 individuals stationed at Alert, Ellesmere Island, increasing the credibility of the sighting.
The sighting occurred in daylight at approximately 1730 hours, allowing for clear visibility of the object.
The prevailing cloud layer and altitude of the sighting were noted, providing contextual information for the observation.
sighted object: circular, bright object with reflective qualities
witnesses: 4 individuals stationed at Alert, Ellesmere Island
